text: Richard Realf Braggins (December 25, 1879 – August 16, 1963) was an American baseball player who pitched in only four games over the course of about six weeks for the 1901 Cleveland Blues. In 32 innings he gave up 17 runs on 44 hits, struck out 1 and walked 15. He attended Case School of Applied Science (now Case Western Reserve University) from 1898–1901 where he was a member of the baseball and track teams.http://seamheads.com/baseballgauge/player.php?playerID=braggdi01 Braggins, while also a player, was manager of the Case baseball team from 1899–1901.https://case.edu/its/archives/Coaches/braggins_richard.htm Braggins was a member of Phi Delta Theta fraternity. ==References== ==External links== Category:1879 births Category:1963 deaths Category:Baseball players from Pennsylvania Category:People from Mercer, Pennsylvania Category:Cleveland Blues (1901) players Category:Major League Baseball pitchers Category:Case Western Spartans baseball coaches Category:Case Western Spartans baseball players Category:Cleveland Lake Shores players
title: Dick Braggins
